separators.comment: All thresholds and weights multiplied by 10x for better granularity

scoring.comment: Weights for boundary scoring - will be learned from training data

prefixPattern.comment: Short left (1-2 syl), longer right, prefix-like (re.fenga, Dr.) [10x]

ruleBSimilarSyllables.comment: RULE B: 3+ syllables same length, same starting consonant (bat-bet-bit) [10x]

criticalCluster.comment: CRITICAL - impossible to pronounce (tl, dl, pn, bn, dn, gn, kn, sr, zr, pb, td, kg, dt, gk, bd) - FINE-TUNED [10x]

heavySimilarRhyme.comment: Heavy syllables (4+ chars) with exact rhyme: brak-drak, glumrik-fendik (-ak, -ik endings) - FINE-TUNED [10x]

heavyPartialRhyme.comment: Heavy syllables with partial rhyme: brak-brek (similar structure, same final consonant) - FINE-TUNED [10x]

hardCluster.comment: Hard consonant cluster (kd, kt, bd, bk, etc.) - FINE-TUNED [10x]

heavyAndHeavy.comment: Both syllables are heavy (4+ chars): brak-flum, drak-glum - FINE-TUNED [10x]

moderateCluster.comment: Moderate difficulty cluster (fs, sz, fp, etc.) - FINE-TUNED [10x]

identicalConsonants.comment: Same consonant repeated (t+t in bat-tak) - FINE-TUNED [10x]

samePlaceArticulation.comment: Both consonants from same place (bilabial, alveolar, velar) - FINE-TUNED [10x]

interestBonus.comment: Hyphen interest bonus - small to reach ~2-3% [10x]

ruleBSimilarSyllables.comment: RULE B: 3+ syllables same length, same starting consonant (bat-bet-bit) - FINE-TUNED [10x]

cleanConsonantBoundary.comment: Consonant end + consonant start, not hard cluster (bunok fenga) - INCREASED to win 2x more often than hyphen [10x]

heavyAndHeavySpace.comment: Heavy + Heavy can use space too (compete 2:1 with hyphen): bunok fenga, dafen braklo - INCREASED to prefer space [10x]

cleanSyllables.comment: Both syllables end/start cleanly (CVC + CV) - INCREASED for more space usage [10x]

naturalWordSplit.comment: Both parts are word-like length (4+ chars each) - INCREASED for more space usage [10x]

interestBonus.comment: Space is natural separator - INCREASED to make space more attractive [10x]

ruleBSimilarSyllables.comment: RULE B: 3+ syllables same length, same starting consonant - INCREASED to match hyphen priority [10x]

creativePattern.comment: Creative/technical separator - BASE weight to reach ~10% usage [10x, then 4x]

alternativeToDot.comment: Alternative to dot - replaces dot in some cases (prefix patterns) - DECREASED [10x]

alternativeToHyphen.comment: Alternative to hyphen - replaces hyphen in some cases (moderate clusters) - DECREASED [10x]

heavyRhyme.comment: Heavy syllables with rhyme patterns (brak~drak style) - DECREASED [10x]

cleanBoundary.comment: Clean consonant boundary where tilde adds creative touch - DECREASED [10x]

interestBonus.comment: Tilde interest bonus - increased to reach ~10% [10x, then 4x]

impossibleClusters.comment: Consonant pairs that are impossible/very difficult to pronounce across syllable boundaries (English alphabet only)

critical.comment: Critical - require separator (very hard/impossible to pronounce)

hard.comment: Hard - strongly prefer separator (difficult but not impossible)

identicalConsonants.comment: Same consonant repeated - always prefer separator

placeOfArticulation.comment: Clusters with same place of articulation are often difficult
placeOfArticulation.note: Two consonants from same place are harder to distinguish

rhymePatterns.comment: Common rhyming endings for heavy syllables - prefer hyphen when matching

sameConsonantPattern.comment: Same consonant structure (tik:tok, brak:brik) - matching consonants in both syllables

similarStructure.comment: Similar syllable structure (CVC:CVC, CV:CV) with matching positions

separatorBalancing.comment: Automatic balancing adjusts scores based on recent usage to match target distribution
